answers.answer: I was diagnosed with it.  It's not so bad. Just do what your team tells you and everything should be fine... My doc hasn't mentioned a thing about being induced and I've just hit 37 weeks :)

I was diagnosed with it at 30 weeks. It's really not that bad just follow the diet plan and you'll be fine as for being induced early yes its true all doctors are different though im 38 weeks and im going to be induced next week. Most doctors don't let woman with gestational diabetes go full term because it's considered a high risk pregnancy.
Thanks ladies!! I will definitely do my best to keep it under control,  good luck with delivey! :)
Not entirely true... My Dr only said that would happen if I had to start taking insulin.  Just try to control your diet... It's tough at first but it does get easier.

I was diagnosed at 18 weeks. Insulin overnight since 20 weeks. Diabetes can cause a host of things. It can age the placenta prematurely. However in most cases it's different from doctor to doctor. Case to case. Relax and enjoy being pregnant.

I was diagnosed with gd at 28 weeks so they said because of that i have a high risk pregnancy and i need to be checked and have a sonogram each week. At the very first appointment at the high risk clinic they told me i will get induced at 39 weeks dr said placenta starts deteriorating after that time when you have gd. I got scheduled for nov 7
I have diabetes.  20 years. They don't let you go past 39 weeks. Watch your diet - it ***** big time!! Do your best - healthiest for you and baby

question: I'm 3days from 33 weeks, did my 3hr glucose test yesterday,  received a call last night from the nurse saying it came back positive for gestational diabetes.  Now i have to check and record my sugar four times a day and bunch of other not so fun stuff, this is going to suck but anything for my baby.  any other mamas out there with GD? Is it true you get induced earlier?
title: Gestational diabetes anyone?
